intro: Euklisia biolettii, commonly known as the desert mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant has narrow, silvery-green leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its propagation across dry landscapes. Euklisia biolettii is well adapted to extreme conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species in desert ecosystems.
